question: A player challenges the referee's authority. Must the referee;

options.text: Black card the offender
Order the player off (red card)
Note the offender
Caution the player (yellow card)

question: An opposing team official is assaulted by a player during a game. Must the referee;

options.text: Take no action but report the incident
Order off (Red Card) the player
Caution the player (Yellow Card) and order the official from the sideline
Black Card the player

question: In a game which goes to Extra Time a player commits a Noting Infraction during the playing of Extra Time, having previously been noted during the playing of ordinary time. Should the referee:

options.text: Award a free kick and Note the player and warn him that a further noting will lead to a Caution (Yellow Card)
Award a free kick and Black card the player
Award a free kick and Caution the player (Yellow Card)
Award a free kick only

question: What should the referee do when the ball strikes him and in so-doing is prevented from crossing the goal-line?

options.text: Award a penalty
Award a goal
Throw in the ball on the 13m line
Throw the ball in on the 20m line

question: If a ball accidentally strikes the referee from a free must he;

options.text: Allow the free kick to be retaken
Stop the game and award a throw-in at the point where the ball struck him
Allow play to continue

question: Match the Infraction with the penalty. Which of the following pairings are correct? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Challenge the authority of a Referee → Caution (Yellow card)
Show dissent with the Referee's decision to award a free kick to the opposing team → The free kick shall be taken 50m more advantageous
Abusive language to a Referee → Order off (Red Card)
Remonstrate in an aggressive manner with a Referee → Black Card
Refuse to leave the field of play when ordered off → First give a three minute warning to the captain, then if the player refuses to comply, terminate the game

question: A linesman, who has gone on to the field to attend to an injured player, is struck by the ball in play. What is the correct award?

options.text: Throw-in the ball at the point where it struck the linesman
Free kick to the team which last played the ball
Play on
Free kick to the opposing team

question: A player "accidentally" trips an opponent. What is the correct award?

options.text: Free kick only to the team of the player who was tripped
Play On
Free kick and Black Card for Cynical Behaviour infraction
Free kick and noting
Free kick and caution (Yellow Card)

question: The ball, having been played by an attacking player, strikes the corner flag and comes back into the field of play. What is the correct award?

options.text: Allow play to continue
Sideline kick to the defending team
Throw-in on the 20m line, 13m in from the sideline
Wide

question: Which of the following is not an ordering off (Red Card) infraction?

options.text: To spit at an opponent
To use provocative language to an opponent
To behave in any way which is dangerous to an opponent
To kick an opponent with minimal force

question: The attacking team is in possession inside the 13m line when the referee stops play to enable a seriously injured player to be treated on the field of play. How is play restarted?

options.text: A free kick on the 13m line to the attacking team opposite the point where the play was stopped
A throw-in at the position where the play was when stopped
A throw-in on the 20m line opposite where the play was stopped
A throw-in on the 13m line opposite the point where the play was stopped
A free kick on the 20m line to the attacking team opposite the point where the play was stopped

question: A player deliberately lies on the ball to prevent an opponent playing it. Must the referee;

options.text: Award a free against the offender
Note the offender
Stop the play and throw in the ball

question: Match the following Infractions to the penalty associated with each. Which pairings are correct? (Select all that apply)

options.text: To remonstrate in an aggressive manner with the Referee → Black Card
Abusive language towards a Referee → Order off (Red Card)
To challenge the authority of a Referee → Caution (Yellow card)
Refuse to leave the field of play when ordered off → First give a three minute warning to the captain, then if the player refuses to comply, terminate the game
To show dissent with the Referee's decision to award a free kick to the opposing team → The free kick shall be taken 50m more advantageous

question: If an attacking player carries the ball over his opponent's goal line, the referee should award a goal?

options.text: True
False

question: Which of the following results in a penalty being awarded? (Tick all)

options.text: The goalkeeper takes 6 steps while in possession inside the small rectangle
A defender pulls down an attacking player inside the large rectangle but outside the small rectangle
An attacking player, 30m out is fouled after he kicks the ball and the ball lands inside the small rectangle
The goalkeeper, while challenging for a ball, pushes an attacking player in the back, inside the large rectangle but outside the small rectangle
A defender picks the ball directly from the ground outside the small rectangle but inside the large rectangle

question: Match the following Infractions to the penalty relating to them. Which pairings are correct? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Strike with the hand → Order off (Red Card)
Engage in any other form of rough play → Caution (Yellow Card)
Push an opponent with the hands → Free only
Deliberate Pull Down → Black Card (Cynical Behaviour)

question: A defending player carries the ball over his own goal line, the referee must award a goal

options.text: True
False

question: Which of the following is not an ordering off (Red Card) infraction?

options.text: To kick an opponent with minimal force
To behave in any way which is dangerous to an opponent
To spit at an opponent
To use provocative language to an opponent

question: The side-line officials bring an infraction of rough or dangerous play to the attention of the Referee during a break in play, what should the Referee do.

options.text: Side-line Official is not allowed to bring any incident to attention of the Referees
Apply the appropriate sanction as per rule.

question: A sideline kick is played by an opponent who is not 13m from the spot where the sideline ball was kicked. Should the referee;

options.text: Award a free kick 13m more advantageous than the place of the original kick
Order the sideline kick to be retaken
Allow play to continue

question: The ball, having been played by a defending player, strikes the corner flag and comes back into the field of play. What is the correct award?

options.text: Throw-in on the 20m line, 13m in from the sideline
Allow play to continue
Sideline kick to the attacking team
45m kick to the attacking team

question: The penalty for charging, in a manner otherwise permissible the goalkeeper within the small rectangle is;

options.text: Free only
Caution (Yellow Card)
Black Card
Order Off (Red Card)
Noting

question: Which of the following is an ordering off (Red Card) infraction?

options.text: To spit at opponent
To block with the boot when an opponent is kicking the ball from the hands
To deliberately pull down an opponent
To threaten an opponent

question: An opposing player deliberately blocks, within 13m, the Free kick of a player who has been awarded a "Mark". What should the Referee do?

options.text: Award a free kick 13m more advantageous
Allow play to continue
Award a free kick at the point at which the ball is blocked
Allow the free kick to be retaken

question: A player is fouled in possession, but the referee decides to allow 'advantage' but the player takes 6 steps before gaining advantage and scoring. Must the referee;

options.text: Allow the score
Award a free for the original foul
Cancel the score and order a free out

question: A player who has possession of the football has the ball pulled from him by an opponent with both hands. What is the correct decision?

options.text: Throw-in the ball between a player from each side
Award a free-kick to the player who originally had possession, and Note the offender
Allow play to continue
Award a free-kick to the player who originally had possession, with no other action

question: Which of the following is not a "free only" infraction?

options.text: To push an opponent with the hands
To hold an opponent with the hands
While in possession of the ball to charge an opponent
To charge (in a manner otherwise permissible) the goalkeeper in the small rectangle

question: How far are defenders and attackers obliged to be from the player taking a free or sideline kick?

options.text: 10 Metres
20 Metres
13 Metres

question: The correct award for holding an opponent is?

options.text: Free only
Free and Black card
Free and Order off (Red Card)
Free and Caution (Yellow Card)
Free and Note

question: Which of the following are immediate ordering off (Red Card) infractions? (Please select all).

options.text: To use threatening language to a Sideline Official
To contribute to a melee
To spit at an opponent
To deliberately collide with an opponent to take him out of a movement of play
To assault an opposing Team Official
To remonstrate in an aggressive manner with a Match Official

question: If a ball accidentally strikes the linesman which prevents it from going over the sideline must the referee;

options.text: Stop the game and award a throw-in 13m from the sideline in a direct line with the place where the ball struck the linesman
Award a sideline kick
Stop the game and award a throw-in at the point where the ball struck the linesman
Allow play to continue

question: In Inter-County games all substitutions must be from players on the list submitted to the Referee

options.text: True
False

question: In the event of a player receiving an injury which results in bleeding, is the Referee obliged in rule to order the player to leave the field of play to receive treatment.

options.text: Yes
No

question: For extra time in a club game how many changes are permitted for the start of extra time from the team which finished normal time?

options.text: Any 15 may start extra time (except those sent off during normal time)
One
None
Five
Three

question: Prior to the start of a game two players from opposing sides attempt to strike each other with the hand. What action must the referee take? (Note: The referee has not received the team sheets).

options.text: Caution both players
Order both off and do not allow substitutes
Take no action but include in his Referee's Report
Take no action
Order both off and allow substitutes

question: Prior to the start of a game two players from opposing sides attempt to strike each other with the hand. What action must the referee take? (Note: The referee has received the team sheets).

options.text: Caution both players
Take no action
Take no action but include in his Referee's Report
Order both off and do not allow substitutes
Order both off and allow substitutes

question: The ball goes wide. Is the referee obliged by rule to blow his whistle?

options.text: It is up to the referee
Yes
No

question: In an Inter-County Senior Championship game the interval shall consist of a maximum of?

options.text: 20 minutes
10 minutes
15 minutes

question: The Referee's Report should contain the names of the umpires and linesmen.

options.text: No
Yes

question: The referee has the authority to order a goalkeeper to change a jersey if it is the same colour as the opposition jerseys

options.text: True
False

question: In the event of a player refusing to comply with the Referee's instruction to remove or make safe an item of equipment, dress or jewellery which could cause injury, the Referee must

options.text: Instruct that the player is substituted
Ignore the situation
Caution (Yellow card) the player
Order off (Red card) the player

question: A player receives a caution (Yellow Card) during "normal time" and is again cautioned (Yellow Card) during the playing of extra time. Must the player then be sent off (red card)?

options.text: No
Yes

question: Which of the following should be contained in the Referee's Report? (Select all correct)

options.text: The names of the secretaries
The identity of the captains
The names of the umpires
The names of the two team managers
The names of temporary substitutions
The final score
The starting time of the game

question: If the referee blows his whistle for a free to be taken and then realises that he has made a mistake, is he permitted in Rule to alter his decision?

options.text: Yes
No

question: At the commencement of play the referee shall toss a coin for choice of ends in the presence of:

options.text: Any two players nominated by team officials
The team captains
A player or team official from each side

question: A player uses abusive or provocative language or gestures to a team-mate. Must the referee;

options.text: Black Card the offender and award a throw-in
Award a free to the opposing team
Black Card the offender and award a free
Caution the player (Yellow Card) and award a throw-in
Caution the player (Yellow Card) and award a free

question: Which of the following are Cynical Behaviour (Black Card) Infractions? (Please select all)

options.text: To deliberately pull down an opponent
To deliberately trip an opponent with the foot
To engage in any other form of rough play
To deliberately collide with an opponent for the purpose of taking him out of a movement of play
To contribute to a melee
To use abusive gestures to a team-mate
To use abusive language to a Referee

question: Under the Playing Rules if a defending player makes an Advanced Mark inside the 13m line the free-kick (if availed of) shall be taken from where?

options.text: The 13m line directly in line with where the Mark is awarded
The 20m line directly in line with where the Mark is awarded
The point at which the Mark is awarded

question: Under the Playing Rules, a player who commits a Cynical Behaviour Infraction (Black Card) is ordered to the Sin-bin for how long?

options.text: 15 minutes
5 minutes
10 minutes

question: Under the Playing Rules the maximum number of substitutes allowed is

options.text: Four
Six
Three
Five
